meanings.definition: To ascertain the size, amount, or degree of something.
meanings.sent1: She will measure the length of the table with a ruler.
meanings.sent2: He measures the ingredients carefully when baking a cake.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to measure the height of the counter by jumping.
meanings.sent4: His dedication can be measured by the number of hours he practices.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a measuring tape to show the students how to measure accurately.

meanings.definition: A unit or standard used for quantifying or comparing.
meanings.sent1: The meter is a common measure of length.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for a measure of sugar.
meanings.sent3: The clown used an oversized measure cup to make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was a measure of her true character.
meanings.sent5: The ruler is a useful measure for drawing straight lines.

meanings.definition: A plan or course of action taken to achieve a particular goal.
meanings.sent1: The team implemented a new measure to increase productivity.
meanings.sent2: The safety measure prevented accidents in the workplace.
meanings.sent3: The measure to wear pajamas to work was a hilarious prank.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the measure that led him to success.
meanings.sent5: The measure of studying every day paid off during the exam.
